title: The Amazing Ways Global Consulting Firm BCG Uses AI Internally
author: Bernard Marr

key_facts: BCG has rolled out Enterprise GPT to all employees globally.
Enterprise GPT is an enterprise-licensed AI tool with data control and access restrictions.
BCG has developed over 3,000 custom GPTs built by consultants for specific engagements.
A consultant completed 2030 interviews and produced insights and slides in three days using Enterprise GPT.
The process of transcribing, distilling insights, and creating slides previously took two weeks.
BCG uses a task force led by a senior partner to identify high-impact AI use cases in internal functions and consulting workflows.
Consultants spend 50% of their time writing slides and 30% on online research.
Senior consultants spend 6070% of their time in meetings, not writing slides.
BCG developed a proprietary tool called Dexter to generate slide drafts in seconds via prompts.
BCG conducted a controlled experiment with 750 consultants to measure AI impact on productivity.
For straightforward tasks, new hires saw 3040% productivity gains using AI.
Experienced consultants saw 2030% productivity increases when using AI.
On complex tasks involving math or derivation, junior consultants productivity dropped by 340%.
AI hallucinations can occur due to outlier data patterns in historical datasets.
Human experts are required to validate AI outputs, especially when anomalies appear.
BCG fine-tunes individual GPTs based on repeated usage and error patterns.
Third-party vendors are embedding more safety checks and constraints into their models over time.
BCG uses regular weekly team meetings and bi-monthly executive reporting to monitor AI integration.
key_opinions: Generative AI acts as a superpower that enables faster insight generation and decision-making.
AI should be used as a thought partner, not a fully autonomous workflow driver.
Over-reliance on AI without human validation risks reducing long-term skill development.
The future of consulting will shift toward change management and workflow redesign.
AI adoption must be driven by both top-down strategy and bottom-up innovation.
Organizations should not wait for perfect toolsstarting early helps uncover governance challenges.
Outsourcing AI implementation without building internal capability leads to unsustainable outcomes.
Leadership alignment is critical for adopting AI-driven changes, especially when incentives conflict.
Prompt engineering and sanity checking skills are becoming essential for consultants.
The most valuable role of consultants will evolve from execution to strategic oversight and validation.
key_datapoints: 750 consultants participated in the AI productivity experiment.
New hires experienced 3040% productivity boost on straightforward tasks.
Experienced consultants saw 2030% productivity increase on routine tasks.
Junior consultants' productivity dropped by 340% on complex mathematical tasks.
Over 3,000 custom GPTs have been built within BCG.
One client process was reduced from 10 days to 2 minutes using AI.
Consultants spend 50% of time writing slides and 30% on research.
Senior consultants spend 6070% of time in meetings.
Enterprise GPT ensures project-specific IP remains accessible only to authorized team members.
AI-generated growth projections were accurate 90% of the time but missed outliers 10% of the time.
BCG reports progress to the executive committee every two months.
Custom GPTs are ranked on a public leaderboard based on usage frequency.
Digital avatar project prompted legal, compliance, and risk reviews over three weeks.
AI tools reduced slide creation time from hours to seconds via prompt-based drafting.
BCGs internal AI rollout began with a pilot that informed broader deployment.
